Using the @json directive, you can retrieve and format JSON data with lodash templates.

For example:

@json [NYC Weather](https://tranquil-headland-86417.herokuapp.com/weather/10021)

You need to tell the directive what template to use to format the JSON. So in the body of the following node in the leo file, specify the template. You can also add other data that will be added to the JSON retrieved from the data endpoint.

template: weather
location: NYC Central Park
source: OpenWeather Map

By default, Leo Vue comes with just a ‘weather’ template for JSON data from OpenWeather Map. This template is in lib/lodash-template.js. You can add more templates to this file to format other JSON data sources.
